**Playing Old Xbox One Games:**

Yes, you can play your old Xbox One games on the Xbox Series X without having to rebuy them. Microsoft's backward compatibility feature ensures that you can play a vast majority of Xbox One games on the new console, with many receiving performance and visual enhancements.

As long as you've purchased the game digitally through the Microsoft Store or have a physical copy, you can simply download or insert the game disc, and it will work on the Xbox Series X. You won't need to rebuy the game or pay any additional fees.

**Xbox One Controller Compatibility:**

Your old Xbox One controller will work with the Xbox Series X, but with some limitations. The Xbox One controller is compatible with the Xbox Series X, and you can use it to play games that don't require the new controller's features.

However, some games optimized for the Xbox Series X might not work perfectly with the Xbox One controller, as they may utilize features like the Share button, hybrid D-pad, or haptic feedback, which are exclusive to the new controller.

If you want to take full advantage of the Xbox Series X's features and play the latest games, I recommend using the new Xbox Series X controller. But if you're looking to play older games or don't mind missing out on some of the new features, your Xbox One controller will still work just fine.

**Cloud Saves:**

Another benefit of playing your old Xbox One games on the Xbox Series X is that your cloud saves will carry over seamlessly. As long as you've synced your saves to the cloud using the Xbox One's cloud saving feature, you can pick up where you left off on the Xbox Series X without losing any progress.

Microsoft's cloud saving system ensures that your game saves are stored online, allowing you to access them from any Xbox console, including the Xbox Series X. This means you can start playing a game on your Xbox One and then pick it up on your Xbox Series X, without having to worry about losing your progress.

I hope that answers your questions!
